verses.text: ‘OKU pehē ‘e he vale ‘i hono loto, “Oku ‘ikai ha ‘Otua.” Kuo nau fakaka‘anga, pea nau fakalielia ‘i he kovi honau tō‘onga; ‘Oku ‘ikai ha fai lelei ‘e toko taha.
Ne ‘afio hifo mei langi ‘a ‘Elohimi ki he hako ‘o e tangata, Ke vakai pe ‘oku fakapotopoto ha taha, Pe ai ha taha ‘oku kumi ki he ‘Otua.
Kuo nau holomui takitaha; Kuo nau hoko ko e koto fakalielia; ‘Oku ‘ikai ha taha ‘oku fai lelei, ‘oku ‘ikai ‘aupito ha taha.
‘Oku ‘ikai ha‘anau ‘ilo koā, ‘a e fai kovi? ‘A kinautolu ‘oku keina hoku kakai hangē ha kai me‘akai, Ka ko ‘Elohimi ‘oku ‘ikai te nau lotu ki ai.

‘I he potu ko ia na‘a nau mo‘umanavahēa, Ka na‘e ‘ikai hano ‘uhinga ‘o ‘enau ilifia: He kuo tufaki ‘e ‘Elohimi ‘a e hui ‘o ia ‘oku hanga tau mai, Kuo ke fakamaa‘i kinautolu he kuo li‘aki kinautolu ‘e ‘Elohimi.
Taumaiā ke ‘omi mei Saione ‘a e fakamo‘ui ‘o ‘Isileli! Ka fakafoki ‘a e pōpula ‘o hano kakai ‘e ‘Elohimi, Toki hākahaka ‘a Sēkope, toki nēkeneka ai ‘a ‘Isileli.
